DMA_Params_t Struct Reference
DMA Driver External Data Structures

DMA Parameters. More...

#include <drivers/dma/dma.h>

Data Fields

DMA_PriScheme lowPriScheme
 
DMA_PriScheme highPriScheme
 
bool bypassFifo
 

Detailed Description

DMA Parameters.

DMA parameters are used to with the DMA_open() call. These parameters will be applied only in the first DMA_open() call Subsequent DMA_open() calls will ignore this parameter.

Field Documentation

bool DMA_Params_t::bypassFifo

Set to 0 to have FIFO not bypassed (Recommended) Set it to 1 to bypass FIFO

  • Setting 1 to this field limits the FIFO depth to the size of one element. That means that after one element is read, the write-out to the destination will begin. This feature is particularly useful to minimize switching latency between channels. Note: This feature does not make optimal use of bus bandwidth.
DMA_PriScheme DMA_Params_t::highPriScheme

Priority scheme for high priority queue

DMA_PriScheme DMA_Params_t::lowPriScheme

Priority scheme for low priority queue
